page.title: 04Dadlington Church.
page.content: The Church ofSt.James The Greater, Dadlington,is on a small natural hill to one side of the village green.The priest in charge is the Revd.W. Bardsley,the vicar of Stoke Golding.There are two churchwardens. The nearby village hall belongs to the church.The services are as follows: Sunday;sung Eucharist,8.45a.m.The average attendance is 9.On major feastdays during the week,there will be a special service.There is an organist but no choir.During the past 5 years there has been 1 burial,2 baptisms and 1 reading of banns.The church seats 70-75 people and has a medieval timbered roof and a South Chapel reached by a 13th century arcade.There are 2 bells whose ropes are behind a wooden partition at the back of the church.There is a memorial for 5 local men killed in the 1st war.
